Clean gutters and downspouts,#1,,Prevents water damage by ensuring water can properly drain from the roof and away from the house,Gutters and downspouts clogged with leaves and debris,8,"1. Secure a sturdy ladder and safety gear.
2. Remove debris and leaves from gutters and downspouts with a trowel or scoop.

1. Rinse gutters and downspouts with a hose.
2. Ensure water flows freely from the downspouts away from the house.
3. Trim overhanging branches and foliage away from the roof and gutters to prevent future clogging.",Fall,"Before winter, leaves have fallen and can clog gutters and downspouts. "

Clean and inspect chimney and flue,#1,,Prevents chimney fires and carbon monoxide poisoning due to creosote buildup or blockages in the flue,Chimney and flue not cleaned or inspected,9,"1. Secure a sturdy ladder and safety gear.
2. Remove any debris or blockages from the chimney with a brush or scraper.

1. Inspect the flue for any cracks or damage.
2. Check that the chimney cap is securely in place.
3. Hire a professional chimney sweep to inspect and clean the chimney every 1-2 years.",Fall,"Before winter, when the fireplace is likely to be used more frequently.",Chimney brush, scraper, safety gear

Inspect and repair roof,#1,,Prevents water damage and structural issues by identifying and repairing roof damage,Roof leaks or damage,10,"1. Secure a sturdy ladder and safety gear.
2. Inspect the roof for any damage, such as missing or broken shingles, cracks, or holes.

1. Replace any damaged or missing shingles.
2. Seal any gaps or cracks in the roof or around chimneys or vents.
3. Hire a professional roofer to inspect and repair the roof every 2-3 years.",Spring,"After winter, when the roof has been exposed to harsh weather.",Ladder, safety gear, roofing materials

Install gutter guards,#1,,Prevents debris buildup in gutters and reduces the frequency of gutter cleaning,Gutters and downspouts clogged with leaves and debris,7,"1. Measure the length of the gutters and downspouts.
2. Purchase gutter guards that fit the dimensions of the gutters and downspouts.

1. Clean and dry the gutters and downspouts.
2. Attach the gutter guards to the gutters and downspouts according to manufacturer instructions.",Fall,"Before winter, when leaves are falling and can clog gutters.",Gutter guards, measuring tape, safety gear

Clean and maintain sump pump,#1,,Prevents basement flooding by ensuring the sump pump is working properly,Sump pump malfunction or failure,8,"1. Unplug the sump pump and remove it from the pit.
2. Clean the pump and pit of any debris or sediment.

1. Check that the check valve is working properly.
2. Test the pump by pouring water into the pit and ensuring it pumps out the water properly.
3. Consider hiring a professional plumber to inspect and maintain the sump pump every 1-2 years.",Spring,"After winter, when snow and ice melt can cause excess water in the basement.",Sump pump, safety gear
